title: Work & Career
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing professional life, job searching, and workplace dynamics.

words.meaning: a person who applies for a job
words.example: We received over 200 applicants for the position.

words.meaning: advancement to a higher position
words.example: She earned a promotion after just two years.

words.meaning: to voluntarily leave a job
words.example: He decided to resign and start his own business.

words.meaning: no longer needed for a job; laid off
words.example: Fifty workers were made redundant due to automation.

words.meaning: the time by which something must be completed
words.example: We're working overtime to meet the deadline.

words.meaning: the amount of work to be done
words.example: The workload has increased significantly this quarter.

words.meaning: to work together with others
words.example: Our teams collaborate on several projects.

words.meaning: to assign tasks to others
words.example: Good managers know how to delegate effectively.

words.meaning: the ability to act independently; a new plan
words.example: She took the initiative to improve the process.

words.meaning: the effectiveness of productive effort
words.example: Remote work has actually increased productivity.

words.meaning: payment or benefits for work
words.example: The compensation package includes health insurance.

words.meaning: to discuss in order to reach an agreement
words.example: She successfully negotiated a higher salary.

words.meaning: an experienced person who guides others
words.example: My mentor helped me navigate the corporate world.

words.meaning: building professional relationships
words.example: Networking events are essential for career growth.

words.meaning: a person who starts and runs a business
words.example: She became a successful entrepreneur in her thirties.

words.meaning: self-employed and working for various clients
words.example: Many designers work freelance rather than for one company.

words.meaning: to find and hire new employees
words.example: The company is recruiting graduates from top universities.

words.meaning: evaluation of job performance
words.example: Annual appraisals determine salary increases.

words.meaning: a trial period for new employees
words.example: New employees are on probation for three months.

words.meaning: the rate at which employees leave a company
words.example: High turnover indicates workplace problems.

words.meaning: to contract work to external providers
words.example: Many companies outsource customer service.

words.meaning: system of ranking within an organization
words.example: The company has a flat hierarchy with few managers.

words.meaning: something that motivates action
words.example: Bonuses serve as incentives for better performance.

words.meaning: exhaustion from excessive work stress
words.example: Many employees experience burnout from overwork.

words.meaning: able to adapt or change easily
words.example: We offer flexible working hours.

words.meaning: person with interest in a company or project
words.example: We need to consider all stakeholders' perspectives.

words.meaning: skilled and competent
words.example: Candidates must be proficient in Excel.

words.meaning: legal responsibility; a disadvantage
words.example: The company faces significant legal liabilities.

words.meaning: the length of time in a position
words.example: During her tenure as CEO, profits doubled.

words.meaning: to reorganize a company or system
words.example: The company decided to restructure its departments.

words.meaning: a document summarizing qualifications and experience
words.example: Make sure your resume is updated before applying.

words.meaning: a skill or achievement that makes someone suitable
words.example: A master's degree is a key qualification for this role.

words.meaning: responsibility for one's actions
words.example: The new policy increases accountability among managers.

words.meaning: independence and freedom to make decisions
words.example: Employees value autonomy in their work.

words.meaning: combination of two companies into one
words.example: The merger created the largest tech company in Asia.

words.meaning: a company controlled by another company
words.example: The subsidiary operates independently in foreign markets.

words.meaning: collection of work samples or investments
words.example: Your design portfolio should showcase your best work.

words.meaning: extended leave from work for personal development
words.example: She took a sabbatical to travel and recharge.

words.meaning: temporary position for gaining work experience
words.example: The internship provides valuable industry experience.

words.meaning: training program combining work and learning
words.example: He completed a four-year apprenticeship as an electrician.

words.meaning: the act of leaving a job voluntarily
words.example: His resignation came as a surprise to everyone.

words.meaning: to end employment or a contract
words.example: The company decided to terminate his contract early.

words.meaning: to work from home using technology
words.example: Many employees now telework several days a week.

words.meaning: regular payment to retired employees
words.example: The company offers a generous pension scheme.

words.meaning: loss of job due to position elimination
words.example: Mass redundancies followed the factory closure.

words.meaning: formal complaint about workplace treatment
words.example: Employees can file a grievance with HR.

words.meaning: unfair treatment based on personal characteristics
words.example: Age discrimination is illegal in most countries.

words.meaning: openness and clarity in communication
words.example: The company values transparency in decision-making.

words.meaning: a standard for measuring performance
words.example: We use industry benchmarks to evaluate our performance.

words.meaning: to use something to maximum advantage
words.example: We can leverage our expertise to win new clients.

exercises.question: The company decided to _____ its IT services to reduce costs.
New employees undergo a three-month _____ period.
She took the _____ to reorganize the filing system.
The _____ package includes health insurance and a company car.
Good managers know how to _____ tasks effectively.
He became a successful _____ after leaving his corporate job.
High employee _____ can indicate workplace problems.
The _____ of the two companies created a global leader.
Make sure your _____ is updated before applying for jobs.
The company offers _____ working hours to support work-life balance.
We need to _____ with suppliers to get better prices.
Many employees experience _____ from excessive work stress.
The _____ provides valuable industry experience for students.
Employees value _____ in making their own decisions.
The company is _____ graduates from top universities.
Remote work has increased employee _____.
A master's degree is a key _____ for this position.
The company values _____ in all business communications.

We can _____ our expertise to win new clients.

exercises.question: 우리는 그 직책에 200명이 넘는 지원자를 받았습니다.
exercises.answer: We received over 200 applicants for the position.

exercises.question: 그녀는 단 2년 만에 승진했습니다.
exercises.answer: She earned a promotion after just two years.

exercises.question: 그는 사직하고 자신의 사업을 시작하기로 결정했습니다.
exercises.answer: He decided to resign and start his own business.

exercises.question: 자동화로 인해 50명의 근로자가 해고되었습니다.
exercises.answer: Fifty workers were made redundant due to automation.

exercises.question: 우리는 마감 기한을 맞추기 위해 초과 근무를 하고 있습니다.
exercises.answer: We're working overtime to meet the deadline.

exercises.question: 업무량이 이번 분기에 크게 증가했습니다.
exercises.answer: The workload has increased significantly this quarter.

exercises.question: 우리 팀들은 여러 프로젝트에서 협력합니다.
exercises.answer: Our teams collaborate on several projects.

exercises.question: 좋은 관리자는 효과적으로 위임하는 방법을 압니다.
exercises.answer: Good managers know how to delegate effectively.

exercises.question: 그녀는 프로세스를 개선하기 위해 주도권을 잡았습니다.
exercises.answer: She took the initiative to improve the process.

exercises.question: 재택근무는 실제로 생산성을 증가시켰습니다.
exercises.answer: Remote work has actually increased productivity.

exercises.question: 보상 패키지에는 건강 보험이 포함됩니다.
exercises.answer: The compensation package includes health insurance.

exercises.question: 그녀는 더 높은 급여를 성공적으로 협상했습니다.
exercises.answer: She successfully negotiated a higher salary.

exercises.question: 내 멘토는 기업 세계를 탐색하는 데 도움을 주었습니다.
exercises.answer: My mentor helped me navigate the corporate world.

exercises.question: 네트워킹 행사는 경력 성장에 필수적입니다.
exercises.answer: Networking events are essential for career growth.

exercises.question: 그녀는 30대에 성공한 기업가가 되었습니다.
exercises.answer: She became a successful entrepreneur in her thirties.

exercises.question: 많은 디자이너들이 한 회사가 아닌 프리랜서로 일합니다.
exercises.answer: Many designers work freelance rather than for one company.

exercises.question: 회사는 최고 대학의 졸업생들을 채용하고 있습니다.
exercises.answer: The company is recruiting graduates from top universities.

exercises.question: 연례 평가가 급여 인상을 결정합니다.
신입 사원들은 3개월간 수습 기간을 거칩니다.
exercises.answer: New employees are on probation for three months.

exercises.question: 높은 이직률은 직장 문제를 나타냅니다.
The company offers a generous pension scheme.
Employees value autonomy in their work.
The merger created the largest tech company in Asia.
exercises.answer: 합병은 아시아에서 가장 큰 기술 회사를 만들었습니다.

exercises.question: Your design portfolio should showcase your best work.
exercises.answer: 당신의 디자인 포트폴리오는 최고의 작품을 보여줘야 합니다.

exercises.question: She took a sabbatical to travel and recharge.
exercises.answer: 그녀는 여행하고 재충전하기 위해 안식년을 가졌습니다.

exercises.question: The internship provides valuable industry experience.
He completed a four-year apprenticeship as an electrician.
exercises.answer: 그는 전기 기술자로 4년간의 견습 과정을 마쳤습니다.

exercises.question: His resignation came as a surprise to everyone.
The company decided to terminate his contract early.
exercises.answer: 회사는 그의 계약을 조기에 종료하기로 결정했습니다.

exercises.question: Many employees now telework several days a week.
exercises.answer: 많은 직원들이 이제 일주일에 며칠 재택근무를 합니다.

exercises.question: Mass redundancies followed the factory closure.
exercises.answer: 공장 폐쇄 후 대규모 정리해고가 이어졌습니다.

exercises.question: Employees can file a grievance with HR.
exercises.answer: 직원들은 인사부에 고충을 제기할 수 있습니다.

exercises.question: Age discrimination is illegal in most countries.
The company values transparency in decision-making.
exercises.answer: 회사는 의사 결정에서 투명성을 중요하게 여깁니다.

exercises.question: We use industry benchmarks to evaluate our performance.
exercises.answer: 우리는 성과를 평가하기 위해 산업 벤치마크를 사용합니다.

exercises.question: We can leverage our expertise to win new clients.
exercises.answer: 우리는 새로운 고객을 확보하기 위해 전문성을 활용할 수 있습니다.

exercises.question: The new policy increases accountability among managers.
exercises.answer: 새로운 정책은 관리자들 사이의 책임감을 높입니다.

exercises.question: A master's degree is a key qualification for this role.
exercises.answer: 석사 학위는 이 직책의 핵심 자격입니다.

exercises.question: Make sure your resume is updated before applying.
The company decided to restructure its departments.
